Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • Unit
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Monster, Player, Villager

    public class Unit
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the base class for all Unit sub-types in the game world.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Unit(int startX, int startY)
      Create a Unit and set it's initial map position

     throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

        startY - the starting y position of the Unit

        public void checkAlive()
        Checks if a unit is still alive (has > 0 HP) and updates alive flag as such

      • checkRadius

        public boolean checkRadius(double pX,
                           double pY,
                           int radius)
        Check if a position is within a radius to the Unit calling this method
        Parameters:
        pX - the x value of a position to check
        pY - the y value of the position to check
        radius - the maximum radius value
        Returns:
        true if the specified position is within the specified radius of the object calling this method

      • cooldownTimer

        public void cooldownTimer(int delta)
        Controls a Unit's cooldown (if applicable)
        Parameters:
        delta - time passed since last frame (milliseconds)

      • move

        public void move(World world,
                 double dirX,
                 double dirY,
                 int delta,
                 double speed)
        Move the Unit in a given direction. Also blocks terrain and, updates the direction the player is facing
        Parameters:
        world - the world the Unit is in (to check blocking)
        dirX - the Unit's movement in the x axis (-1, 0 or 1)
        dirY - the Unit's movement in the y axis (-1, 0 or 1)
        delta - time passed since last frame (milliseconds)
        speed - the speed in (pixel/second) to move the unit

      • renderBar

        public void renderBar(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
        Renders each Unit's status bar above the Unit
        Parameters:
        g - the Slick graphics object, used for drawing
